block.p: In the March 28 Letters column, Jacob Appel, Brown University class of '96, comments on Anne Matthews's "The Campus Crime Wave" by stating that the "baby-boom generation has crippled our economy with a 13-digit debt, depleted our natural resources, permitted our infrastructure to decay, eliminated all standards of common decency and created a war machine capable of liquidating millions of people in a matter of seconds."

Hey, Jacob: I won't be 40 until August -- I'm just starting to roll! Amazing what we boomers have been able to accomplish even though, until recently, we were too young to hold significant public office. BRIAN D. FENWICK
